ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò tɔ́g, Yěsô tsɔ́ʼ tsɔ́ megàŋakwò pé ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a né móm sɔɔnmbʉ́a, ńtúmo wɔ́b mépʉ́a mépʉ́a ngie pɔ́ vɔg ńgwɔ́ mvfò ńgiŋe tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ pâ mejʉʼ mie à ge gÿo pú cʉa wó.
en: After this, the Lord appointed seventy-two   others, and he sent them ahead of him in pairs to every town and place where he himself was about to go.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwaa gʉa, á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Eshúm sie mé gee nkáʼ ndagá é gyɔ́ɔn tɛʼ, nzẅìŋ ngàŋafàʼ piŋ ńkɔ́g. Pi sẅíŋte ngàŋ nkáʼ, à kẅiʼi megàŋafàʼ pie é ge ne laga shúm sé.
en: He told them,   “The harvest   # 10:2 Rv 14:15 is abundant, but the workers   # 10:2 Mt 20:1 are few. Therefore, pray to the Lord of the harvest to send out workers into his harvest.   # 10:2 2Th 3:1

ngiemboon: Pi lo, n túmo gẅí pɔ́ páʼ à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ mé túm púɔ mvfó tsetsɛ̀ɛ metsò.
en: Now go; I’m sending you out like lambs among wolves.

ngiemboon: Tà pi gwaa gʉa ḿbí nkáb, tà pi píi pɔ̀ɔn, tà pi pí melɔ̌ɔn lélɔg ńkúbe metsɔ́. Pi lɔɔn ne ńgee, tà pi zɔ́gɔ mánzsè ńtyé ńtsyɛʼte pʉ̀a.
en: Don’t carry a money-bag,    traveling bag,   # 10:4 Mk 6:8; Lk 9:3; 22:35–36 or sandals;   # 10:4 Mt 10:9–10 don’t greet anyone along the road.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńgʉa tà ńkúu ndá nyìŋ, pi vɔg ńgɔɔn ngie: “E Ssé néŋ mbʉ́lè tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn ndá.”
en: Whatever house you enter, first say, ‘Peace    to this household.’

ngiemboon: Ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ gẅie aa nyìŋ mbʉ́lè lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ndá, mbà mbʉ́lè gi ge gwɔ́ né yé. Tà á té púʼu wɔ́, mbà e ge piŋe na pi.
en: If a person of peace is there, your peace    will rest on him; but if not, it will return to you.

ngiemboon: Pi vɔg tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ ndá wɔ́ɔ, pi néŋe pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ndá ayɛ̌, pi pɔ́ɔn légíŋ ńgʉa tsɔ́ jʉʼ yendyɛ̀ʼɛ, mé náa kɔ́ wɔ́ɔ pi pfɛ́, ńná melùʼ pi nú, té kú shʉ́, mélàʼmie nyìŋ lɔɔn faʼa fàʼ, mbà à ge gẅiin pèen.
en: Remain in the same house, eating and drinking what they offer, for the worker is worthy of his wages.    Don’t move from house to house.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ tÿǒsoŋ wɔ́ɔ, tà pʉ̀a kúe gẅí, ńná pɔ́ kɔ́ wɔ́ɔ, pi jÿó.
en: When you enter any town, and they welcome you, eat the things set before you.

ngiemboon: Megàŋa guɔ gwɔ́ jʉʼó, pi gÿo pɔ́ zéŋe, ńgɔɔn mbwó láʼ ngie: “Anò lefùɔ Ssé tsoté tà ne ḿbɔ́ɔnte.”
en: Heal the sick    who are there, and tell them, ‘The kingdom of God   # 10:9 Mt 12:28; Lk 11:20; 17:20 has come near   # 10:9 Mt 10:7; Mk 1:15; 1Pt 4:7 you.’

ngiemboon: Táʼ, pi lɔɔn ńké ńkúu na tsɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ, epʉ̀a jʉʼó lʉʼʉ lékúe gẅí, pi fó jʉʼó ńgʉa tà ńkúu ndùmo gyɛ̌, ńgɔɔn mbwó láʼ ngie:
en: When you enter any town, and they don’t welcome you, go out into its streets and say,

ngiemboon: “Peg puʼú pfepfɔ́b gí na mekwò még ngie à piŋ nzèm ńkúu twó pi, tá pi ke ńzsé ngie anò lefùɔ Ssé tsoté tà ne ḿbɔ́ɔnte.”
en: ‘We are wiping off even the dust of your town that clings to our feet as a witness against you.    Know this for certain: The kingdom of God has come near.’

ngiemboon: Oon, mèŋ shwóŋo gẅí, á ge láʼ gwɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ gie Ssé ŋaga pʉ̀a mesoŋ, ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ pɛ̌ pʉ̀a gyɔ́ɔn ńcʉa ye pʉ̀a Sondɔm.
en: I tell you, on that day    it will be more tolerable for Sodom   # 10:12 Rv 11:8 than for that town.   # 10:12 Mt 10:15; 11:22,24; Lk 10:14

ngiemboon: Ndòon ee twó pi pʉ̀a Kolazim, mbɔɔ twó pi pʉ̀a Mbɛtsayinda. Menò mɔɔnmɔɔn mie mé la gÿo láʼ pi, é laa péʼe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ Tîi pɔ́ Sindoŋ, mbà pɔ́ leen ńdáʼ ńkúbe mà, ḿmÿɔg, ńtʉ́me pɔ̀ɔn, ḿbiŋ éshʉ́a pfó, ńdɔg ńdúŋ.
en: “Woe    to you,   # 10:13 Ezk 16:23; Mt 23:13–16; Lk 6:24; Rv 9:12 Chorazin!   # 10:13 Mt 11:21 Woe to you, Bethsaida!   # 10:13 Jn 12:21 For if the miracles   # 10:13 Ex 3:20; Lk 19:37; Ac 2:22 that were done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon,   # 10:13 Ezr 3:7; Jr 25:22; 47:4; Jl 3:4; Lk 6:17 they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.   # 10:13 Est 4:1,3; Dn 9:3; Jnh 3:6

ngiemboon: Pi zsé mboŋó ngie á ge láʼ gwɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ gie Ssé ŋaga pʉ̀a mesoŋ, egi ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ cʉa ye pʉ̀a Tîi pâ ye pʉ̀a Sindoŋ,
en: But it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the judgment    than for you.

ngiemboon: ńgʉa na pi pʉ̀a Kapɛ́ɛnàwum, pi kwǎŋ ngie Ssé ge kwéʼe gẅí tà pi kúu lefaŋ ka? E shwóŋo gẅí ngie ngǎŋ, à ge ké sẅíʼi gẅí, pi sẅɛ́ʼ sẅɛ́ʼ tà ńkúu láʼ mepfó.»
en: And you, Capernaum,    will you be exalted to heaven?   # 10:15 Ac 2:33 No, you will go down to Hades.   # 10:15 Is 14:12–15; Ac 2:27

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋ ńgɔɔn mbwó ngàŋakwò yé ngie: «Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzẅíŋe shwóŋè gí, mbà à zẅíŋe pɔ́ shwóŋè yɔ́ɔn. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńdʉʼʉ gẅí, mbà à lʉʼʉ pɔ́ wɔ́ɔn, ńdɔgɔ púʼu, ńdʉʼʉ nyìŋ gẅie à la túmo wɔ́ɔn.»
en: Whoever listens to you listens to me.    Whoever rejects you rejects me.   # 10:16 Mt 25:45; Lk 9:48; Jn 12:48 And whoever rejects me rejects the one who sent me.”   # 10:16 Jn 5:23; 1Th 4:8

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a né móm sɔɔnmbʉ́a pie Yěsô la túm la, é gʉa, ńgwaa piŋ nzèm ńgiŋe ńkága tɛʼ, ńgɔɔn mbwó Yěsô ngie: «Tá weg, afàʼ pǔ ńgiŋ tɛʼ tà peg lɔg lezíŋ shú, ńgɔɔn nò mbwó messé tepòŋ, pɔ́ júʼ ncwò wég.»
en: The seventy-two  ,# 10:17 Ezk 8:11 returned with joy, saying,  # 10:17–20 Mk 16:17–18; Jn 12:31 “Lord, even the demons  # 10:17 Rv 9:20 submit to us in your name.”  # 10:17 Jn 10:25; 14:13

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «Pi gɔɔn éshwóŋo nò, n kɔʼɔ́ ńne ńdíe, ńgyá páʼ Sátà ye ŋwaŋ páʼ nně mbʉ̀ŋ la, éfó tÿǒ lepwó ńtsɔ́ʼɔ ńgwe ssé.
en: He said to them, “I watched Satan    fall from heaven like lightning.   # 10:18 Mt 28:3; Col 2:15

ngiemboon: Pi júʼ, n ka gwaa túmo gẅí páʼa, ńnáa gẅí metʉ̀ lélɔg ńneŋte membɔ̀ɔn pâ mengɔ̀ɔnssé, ńgíŋe ńnáa gẅí metʉ̀ lélɔg ńcʉa Sátà ngàŋmbù tà tsɔ́ mmó le gẅí gÿo.
en: Look, I have given you the authority    to trample   # 10:19 Lk 21:24; Rv 11:2 on snakes   # 10:19 Gn 3:16; Mt 23:33; Rv 9:19 and scorpions   # 10:19 Lk 11:12; Rv 9:3 and over all the power of the enemy;   # 10:19 Mt 13:39; 1Co 15:25 nothing at all will harm you.   # 10:19 Ps 91:13; Mk 16:18; Ac 28:5

ngiemboon: Mbɔɔ púʼu, tà pi kág pɔ́ páʼ messé tepòŋ jǔʼ ncwò gẅí, pi kág páʼ Ssé ŋweʼé mezíŋ mí tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne á tÿǒ lepwó.»
en: However, don’t rejoice that    the spirits   # 10:20 1Tm 4:1; 1Jn 4:1 submit to you,   # 10:20 Mt 7:22–23 but rejoice that your names are written   # 10:20 Ex 32:32; Neh 9:38; Mal 3:16 in heaven.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńgɔɔn yɔɔn nò, à Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a gÿo letʉ́m sé pú ńkág tɛʼ, á leen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie: «Tá wɔ̀ɔn, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, gù gẅie ɔ̀ sáʼa tÿǒ lepwó mbɔɔ tsetsáʼ. Mèŋ sǐe gú páʼ ɔ̀ kéen ńnyɛ mɔɔn menò mbwó mecʉ̀cʉ̀ŋ, ńdÿoon mbwó mengye pâ pʉ̀a pie é la zíʼi. Oon me Tá wɔ̀ɔn, ɔ̀ la gyá ngie ɔ̀ ge gÿo yɔɔn nò pɔ́ púʼu.
en: At that time   he  # 10:21 Other mss read Jesus rejoiced in the Holy  # 10:21 Other mss omit Holy Spirit  # 10:21 Lk 2:27; 4:1; 19:21; Ac 2:4 and said, “I praise   # 10:21 Or thank, or confess you, Father,   # 10:21 Mt 7:21; Lk 23:34,46; Jn 8:42; 11:41; 12:27–28; 17:1–25 Lord of heaven and earth,   # 10:21 Gn 14:19; Ac 17:24 because you have hidden these things from the wise and intelligent   # 10:21 Is 44:25; Jr 8:9; Ac 13:7; 1Co 1:19–27; 3:19–20 and revealed them to infants.   # 10:21 Ps 8:2; Mt 21:16 Yes, Father, because this was your good pleasure.   # 10:21 Lit was well-pleasing in your sight,# 10:21 Lk 2:14

ngiemboon: Tá wɔ̀ɔn léen ńnyé kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ na mbwó mɔ́ɔn, ńgwɔ́ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ le zsé múɔ wɔ́, ndàʼ Tá zɔ zsé yé. Nyìŋ ké le zsé Tá wɔ́, ndàʼ míŋ we zɔ zsé yé, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo nyìŋ gẅie múɔ kwoŋó lényɛɛ Tá we á mbwó yé.»
en: All things have    been entrusted to me by my Father. No one knows who the Son is except the Father, and who the Father is except the Son, and anyone to whom the Son desires   # 10:22 Or wills, or chooses to reveal him.”   # 10:22 Jn 1:18; 6:46; 7:29; 8:19; 10:15; 17:25–26

ngiemboon: Ḿbiŋ sele nnɛ́, ńtsẅe ńgɔɔn mbwó megàŋakwò pé ngie: «Pi ee pashÿó mbòŋo, páʼ pi ne ńgyá shúm sie pi ne ńgyá lɛ̂.
en: Then turning to his disciples he said privately, “Blessed are the eyes that see the things you see!

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ n ké shwóŋo gẅí, lelÿò pantsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé, mbɔɔ mefùɔ, é lǎ tsɔ́ɔn légyá menò mie pi gyá lɛ̂ tɛʼ, pɔ́ té gyá, ńtsɔ́ɔn léjúʼ menò mie pi ne ńjúʼu lɛ̂, pɔ́ té júʼ.»
en: For I tell you that many prophets and kings wanted to see the things you see but didn’t see them; to hear the things you hear but didn’t hear them.”

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nkyàgte mbʉ̌ Ssé tó ńkwaʼte Yěsô, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: «Tsítsà, à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ n gÿo yɔ́ɔn lêkɔ́ tá ńgẅiin legwɔ́ temì?»
en: Then   an expert in the law  # 10:25 Lk 7:30 stood up to test  # 10:25 Mt 16:1; 19:3 him, saying, “Teacher,  # 10:25 Mt 8:19; Lk 3:12; Jn 1:38 what must I do to inherit eternal life? ”  # 10:25 Mt 19:29; Lk 18:18; Jn 12:25; Rv 21:7

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn mbwó yé ngie: «À kɔ́ aa ye ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne lepʉ̌? Ɔɔ ńtóŋo jú ńjúʼu pɔ́ lêkɔ́?»
en: “What is written in the law? ” he asked him. “How do you read it? ”

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «N tǒŋ ńjúʼ ngie: “Kwoŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé jù né ngwòŋ ntʉ́m gú ntsèm, ńtÿɔ́g pɔ́ yé mvfò na jú kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, ḿbiŋ ńdɔg metʉ̀ mú ntsèm éfaʼa mbwó yé, ńzába kwàŋte jú ndàʼ na yé, ńgíŋ ńkwoŋo fɛ̌ gù nyìŋ mesoŋ páʼ twó mbùm jú la.”»
en: He answered, “Love the Lord your God    with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your strength, and with all your mind,”   # 10:27 Dt 6:5 and “your neighbor as yourself.”   # 10:27 Lv 19:18; Dt 6:5,# 10:27 Lv 19:18

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn mbwó yé ngie: «Ɔ̀ tsɔ̌ʼ mboŋó, gÿo púʼu, ńdáʼ ńgẅiin legwɔ́ temì.»
en: “You’ve answered correctly,” he told him. “Do this and you will live.”

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ gwaa zoŋo twó yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Ayɛ̂ tà ḿboŋ, tà fɛ̌ wɔ̀ɔn nyìŋ mesoŋ aa páʼɔɔn ńgwɔ́ wɔ́?»
en: But wanting to justify himself,   he asked Jesus, “And who is my neighbor? ”  # 10:29 Ex 20:16–17; Lv 6:2; 19:13–18; Pr 3:28–29; Mt 5:43; 19:19; Rm 13:9–10

ngiemboon: Yěsô lɔg sagánò ńtsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ lǎʼ fó Yelúzálèm, ńne ńcwóŋo né Yelíkò, metsǒŋ gwoon yé mánzsè, ńkẅé shúm sé, ésẅɛ menzsǒ na yé, ńcúɔ yé ḿbwɔ́ʼte tà á cʉ́ʼʉ ńgee pɔ́ ńkwé, pɔ́ gwáʼa yé ńkÿo.
en: Jesus took up the question and said, “A man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho and fell into the hands of robbers. They stripped him, beat him up, and fled, leaving him half dead.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nùŋepwɔʼ ye Yúndà gÿo ne ńcʉa jʉʼó, ńgyá nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ nuŋe ssé, á líʼte, ḿpfó na yetsɔ́ gwoŋó nzsè, ńtɔ́g ńcʉa.
en: A priest happened to be going down that road. When he saw him, he passed by on the other side.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋ ńgwaa cʉa méjʉʼ, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ na pʉ̀a Lěvî, gẅie pɔ́ zɔ̌ faʼa ndá Ssé, á tó yé tà ńkúu jʉʼó, ńgyá nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ nuŋe, á gíŋ ńgÿo yé pɔ́ púʼu, ńdíʼte, ḿpfó na yetsɔ́ gwoŋó nzsè, ńtɔ́g ńcʉa.
en: In the same way, a Levite, when he arrived at the place and saw him, passed by on the other side.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ Samalîɛ ne ńgee né legìŋ, ńgʉa tà ńkúu jʉʼó, ńgyá yé, mezìŋe mé kúu yé.
en: But a Samaritan    on his journey came up to him, and when he saw the man, he had compassion.   # 10:33 Lk 7:13; 15:20

ngiemboon: Á tóo lejʉ́ŋ yé, ńdɔg melùʼ sɔg mefʉ̌ŋ mé, ńdɔg mevɛ́ ńcÿɔʼ, ńdɔg shúm nzsǒ ńkwɛ́, ńdeen ńké ńkaa yé na nɔ̀ɔn gẅie à gwaa tó, ńnéŋe mǒ, ńdɔgɔ yé ńgʉa tà ńkúu ndá gie megʉ̀ péen, ńdáʼa wó, ńdáʼa láʼ ńdíe yé.
en: He went over to him and bandaged his wounds, pouring on olive oil    and wine. Then he put him on his own animal, brought him to an inn, and took care of him.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, á gyá ngàŋ ndá, éfaʼ nkáb pàg pʉ́a, ńnáa mbwó yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: “Kɔ nkáb yɛ̂, ńcʉ́ʼ ne ńdɔgɔ ńzoŋo nyìŋ wɔɔn. E lɔɔn ńcʉ́ʼ ńkɔ́g tà ɔ̀ kẅiʼi pɔ́ láa wɔ́, mbà n ge cʉ́ʼʉ lépiŋ nzèm, é tsɔ́ʼ náa mbwó gù.”»
en: The next day    he took out two denarii,   # 10:35 A denarius = one day’s wage. gave them to the innkeeper, and said, ‘Take care of him. When I come back I’ll reimburse you for whatever extra you spend.’

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn púʼu, ńdeen ńké ńzɛ́te nkyàgte mbʉ̌ Ssé ŋwɛ́ ngie: «Ɔ̀ kwǎŋ jú ngie á gʉa na pʉ̀a pɔɔn métá, awɔ̌ aa mǒ, ńgwɔ́ páʼ fɛ̌ nyìŋ gẅie metsǒŋ la gwoon yé lɔɔn?»
en: “Which of these three do you think proved to be a neighbor to the man who fell into the hands of the robbers? ”

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn ngie: «N kwǎŋ ngie aa nyìŋ gẅie à la tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mé, ńzoŋo yé.» Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Lò, kwàʼ gù jú, néŋe ńgÿo jú púʼu.»
en: “The one who showed mercy   to him,” he said.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pâ megàŋakwò pé gÿo ńcʉ́me mánzsè ńne ńgee, ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ láʼ. Atsɔ̌ manzwě gẅie mé tóŋo yé lê Mágtà kúe yé ndá yé.
en: While they were traveling, he entered a village, and a woman named Martha   welcomed him into her home.  # 10:38 Other mss omit into her home

ngiemboon: Mágtà la gẅiin fɛ̌ we wemanzwě, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ lê Malîɛ. Yěsô tó tà ńnéŋe ssé, Malîɛ tó ńnéŋe lejʉ́ŋ yé, ńne ńjúʼu shwóŋè yé.
en: She had a sister named Mary, who also sat at the Lord’s   feet  # 10:39 Lk 8:35; Ac 22:3 and was listening to what he said.  # 10:39 Lit to his word or message

ngiemboon: Mágtà ne ńgége nnɛ́ lécwoŋte shúm léjÿó, ńnéŋe tà ńtóo lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Andè, tà ɔ̀ gyǎ jú ngie áa mbòŋ páʼ Malîɛ ně ńgʉa ńnéŋe jʉʼɛ, ḿbú ńnyé fàʼ né mèŋ gíle mèŋ? Tsẅi ngie à tó ńkẅéte wɔ́ɔn la.»
en: But Martha was distracted by her many tasks, and she came up and asked, “Lord, don’t you care   that my sister has left me to serve alone? So tell her to give me a hand.”  # 10:40 Or tell her to help me,# 10:40 Rm 8:26

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: «Mágtà, Mágtà, ɔ̀ púʼ mbùm jù, ńgwá ńgyá ngɔ́ʼ na shúm tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: The Lord   answered her, “Martha, Martha, you are worried and upset about many things,   # 10:41 Lk 12:22; 1Co 7:32; Php 4:6

ngiemboon: Táʼ, tàʼa mmó gwɔ́ wó, ńgwɔ́ tʉ̀nzẅìŋ, Malîɛ kaŋá yɛ̌ ŋwɛ́, à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ nyìŋ le láʼ fó mbwó yé tà ńkẅé wɔ́.»
en: but one thing is necessary.   ,# 10:42 Ps 16:5; 27:4; Jn 6:27 Mary has made the right choice,   # 10:42 Lit has chosen the good part, or has chosen the better portion; = the right meal and it will not be taken away from her.”
